activity_id.AerChemMIP: Aerosols and chemistry model intercomparison project: exploration of aerosol chemistry.
activity_id.C4MIP: Coupled climate carbon cycle model intercomparison project: exploration of the response of the coupled carbon-climate system.
activity_id.CFMIP: Cloud feedback model intercomparison project. Focussed primarily on cloud feedbacks with a secondary focus on understanding of response to forcing, model biases, circulation, regional-scale precipitation, and non-linear changes.
activity_id.CMIP: CMIP core common experiments i.e. the DECK (Diagnostic, Evaluation and Characterization of Klima).
activity_id.DAMIP: Detection and attribution model intercomparison project: exploration of the role of individual forcings (both anthropogenic and natural) in past and future climate change.
activity_id.GeoMIP: Geoengineering model intercomparison project: exploration of the climate response to solar radiation manipulation.
activity_id.LMIP: Land surface, snow and soil moisture model intercomparison project: assessment of land surface, snow and soil moisture feedbacks on climate variability and climate change, and diagnosis of systematic biases in the land modules of Earth system models (ESMs).
activity_id.PMIP: Palaeoclimate modelling intercomparison project: assessment of paleoclimate i.e. climate thousands of years or more in the past.
activity_id.RFMIP: Radiative Forcing Model Intercomparison Project: characterisation of radiative forcing within models.
activity_id.ScenarioMIP: Future scenario experiments. Exploration of the future climate under a (selected) range of possible boundary conditions.

area_label.air: Data is only included where the reporting point is in air (this isn't always the case e.g. if a variable is reported at sea level pressure but there is a mountain then the surface would not be air).
area_label.ccl: Data is only included where the reporting point is in convective cloud.
area_label.cl: Data is only included where the reporting point is in cloud.
area_label.crp: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of crops. Crops is loosely defined and model dependent.
area_label.fis: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of floating ice shelf. Ice shelves are the component of ice sheets that flow over the ocean.
area_label.gis: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of grounded ice sheet. Grounded ice sheets rest over bedrock, excluding ice-caps, glaciers and floating ice shelves.
area_label.ifs: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of sea without ice.
area_label.is: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area where ice sheets are present. It includes both grounded ice sheets resting over bedrock and any ice shelves flowing over the ocean that are attached to grounded ice sheets. It excludes ice-caps and glaciers and any floating ice shelves and ice tongues attached to them.
area_label.li: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area where land ice is present. 'Land ice' means glaciers, ice-caps, grounded ice sheets resting on bedrock and floating ice-shelves.
area_label.lnd: Data is only included where the reporting point is in on land.
area_label.lsi: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of land or sea ice.
area_label.multi: Data is reported on multiple areas. These are indicated by a 'sector' dimension.This area type is typically used for including multiple land-use or vegetation area types in a single file.
area_label.ng: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area where natural grasses are present. 'Natural grasses' means grasses growing in areas of low productivity, often situated on rough or uneven ground. This can include rocky areas, briars and heathland.
area_label.pst: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of pasture. Pastures are assumed to be anthropogenic in origin. They include anthropogenically managed pastureland and rangeland.
area_label.scl: Data is only included where the reporting point is in stratiform cloud.
area_label.sea: Data is only included where there is sea (both ice-free sea and areas with sea ice)
area_label.shb: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of shrubs. Shrubs is loosely defined and model dependent.
area_label.si: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area where sea ice is present.
area_label.simp: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area where melt pond on top of sea ice is present.
area_label.sir: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area where 'ridged' sea ice is present.
area_label.sn: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of snow.
area_label.tree: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of trees. All trees are in the C3 plant functional type. Trees is loosely defined and model dependent.
area_label.u: Unmasked i.e. all areas are included/sampled
area_label.ufs: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of unfrozen soil. Unfrozen soil means that the soil at the surface is unfrozen. Frozen soil may be present at lower levels.
area_label.veg: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of vegetation.
area_label.wl: Data is only included where the reporting point is in an area of wetland. Wetlands are areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season.

1pctCO2.description: 1% per year increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide levels. All other conditions are kept the same as piControl.

1pctCO2-bgc.description: Biogeochemically coupled simulation (i.e. the carbon cycle only 'sees' the increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide, not any change in temperature) of a 1% per year increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide levels. All other conditions are kept the same as piControl.
1pctCO2-bgc.experiment: Biogeochemically coupled simulation (i.e. the carbon cycle only 'sees' the increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide, not any change in temperature) of a 1% per year increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide levels. All other conditions are kept the same as piControl.

piClim-control.description: Baseline for effective radiative forcing (ERF) calculations. `piControl` with prescribed sea-surface temperatures and sea-ice concentrations.
piClim-control.experiment: Baseline for effective radiative forcing (ERF) calculations. `piControl` with prescribed sea-surface temperatures and sea-ice concentrations.

piClim-histaer.description: Simulation of the historical period with prescribed sea-surface temperatures and sea-ice concentrations. Aerosol emissions follow the `historical` experiment while all other forcings follow `piControl` to allow for a (approximate) diagnosis of transient historical aerosol effective radiative forcing (ERF) (can be compared with `piClim-aer` which provides a more precise quantification of present-day aerosol ERF).
piClim-histaer.experiment: Simulation of the historical period with prescribed sea-surface temperatures and sea-ice concentrations. Aerosol emissions follow the `historical` experiment while all other forcings follow `piControl` to allow for a (approximate) diagnosis of transient historical aerosol effective radiative forcing (ERF) (can be compared with `piClim-aer` which provides a more precise quantification of present-day aerosol ERF).

piClim-histall.description: Simulation of the historical period with prescribed sea-surface temperatures and sea-ice concentrations. All forcings follow the `historical` experiment to allow for a (approximate) diagnosis of transient historical effective radiative forcing (ERF).(can be compared with the `piClim-*` experiments which provide a more precise quantification of present-day ERF from various forcers).
piClim-histall.experiment: Simulation of the historical period with prescribed sea-surface temperatures and sea-ice concentrations. All forcings follow the `historical` experiment to allow for a (approximate) diagnosis of transient historical effective radiative forcing (ERF).(can be compared with the `piClim-*` experiments which provide a more precise quantification of present-day ERF from various forcers).

1hrCM.description: Monthly climatology (i.e. mean over a number of months) at hourly resolution.

1hrPt.description: Hourly samples. This is a legacy label that indicated that the sample was a point sample i.e. represented the value at a specific point in time. This information is now conveyed via the temporal label instead.

3hrPt.description: Three hourly samples. This is a legacy label that indicated that the sample was a point sample i.e. represented the value at a specific point in time. This information is now conveyed via the temporal label instead.

6hrPt.description: Six hourly samples. This is a legacy label that indicated that the sample was a point sample i.e. represented the value at a specific point in time. This information is now conveyed via the temporal label instead.

dec.description: Decadal samples. Note that this means that the time interval between each sample is not constant for some calendars.

mon.description: Monthly samples. Note that this means that the time interval between each sample is not constant for some calendars.

monC.description: Monthly climatology (i.e. mean over a number of months) at monthly resolution. Note that this means that the time interval between each sample is not constant for some calendars.

monPt.description: Monthly samples. This is a legacy label that indicated that the sample was a point sample i.e. represented the value at a specific point in time. This information is now conveyed via the temporal label instead.

yr.description: Yearly (i.e. annual) samples. Note that this means that the time interval between each sample is not constant for some calendars.

yrPt.description: Yearly (i.e. annual) samples. This is a legacy label that indicated that the sample was a point sample i.e. represented the value at a specific point in time. This information is now conveyed via the temporal label instead.

horizontal_label.hm: No other horizontal label. This usually means the data is a horizontal mean (therefore has no horizontal dimensions).
horizontal_label.ht: Data along a transect. This is usually some aggregate (sum, mean etc.) along the transect(s).
horizontal_label.hxy: Data on x-y (often lat-lon) grid, also referred to as gridded data.
horizontal_label.hy: Data on y (often just lat) grid. This is usually zonal-mean or zonal-sum or some other zonal-aggregate data.
horizontal_label.hyb: Data on y (often just lat) grids in specific basins. This is usually zonal-mean or zonal-sum or some other zonal-aggregate data.

product.model-output: Output from a model (i.e. numerical representation), in this context typically of the climate system or a component thereof.

realm.aerosol: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to components of the Earth system related to aerosol chemistry.
realm.atmos: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to or is reported in the atmosphere part of the earth system.
realm.atmosChem: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to components of the Earth system related to atmospheric chemistry.
realm.land: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to or is reported in the land surface and/or sub-surface part of the earth system.
realm.landIce: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to or is reported on land ice.
realm.ocean: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to or is reported in the ocean part of the earth system.
realm.ocnBgchem: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to components of the Earth system related to ocean biogeochemistry.
realm.seaIce: Dataset which applies (or mostly applies) to or is reported on sea ice.

region.30S-90S: The area of the globe south of the latitude 30S.

CanESM6-MR.label: Context is wrong - label isn't really a name. Label for plots etc.
CanESM6-MR.label_extended: Context is wrong - extended label isn't really an extended name. Long label with full detail about the source

temporal_label.tavg: Data is the average over each time period (i.e. interval defined by the time bounds).
temporal_label.tclm: Data is a climatology. In this case, it is a monthly climatology i.e. each set of time bounds represents a month and the values show the monthy-by-month variation (derived by averaging over a number of years).
temporal_label.tclmdc: Data is a climatology. In this case, it is a diurnal cycle climatology i.e. each set of time bounds represents an hour and the values show the hour-by-hour variation (derived by averaging over a number of days or months or years).
temporal_label.ti: Data is time independent i.e. has no time dimension. This does not necessarily mean the data has no time relevance e.g. the data may be a mean over all time (therefore not having a time dimension), although such cases are rare (if they exist at all) in CMIP contexts.
temporal_label.tmax: Data is the maximum within each time period (i.e. interval defined by the time bounds).
temporal_label.tmaxavg: Data is the mean of daily maximum over each time period (i.e. interval defined by the time bounds).For example, the data may be reported monthly, with each value being the mean of the daily maximum temperature for each day in the month.
temporal_label.tmin: Data is the minimum within each time period (i.e. interval defined by the time bounds).
temporal_label.tminavg: Data is the mean of daily minimum over each time period (i.e. interval defined by the time bounds).For example, the data may be reported monthly, with each value being the mean of the daily minimum temperature for each day in the month.
temporal_label.tpt: Data represents the value at the specific point in time at which the data is reported (all other time points within each time interval are not considered).
temporal_label.tsum: Data is the sum over each time period (i.e. interval defined by the time bounds).

vertical_label.1000hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 1000 hPa.
vertical_label.100hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 100 hPa.
vertical_label.10hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 10 hPa.
vertical_label.200hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 200 hPa.
vertical_label.20bar: Data is reported at a pressure depth of 20 bar.
vertical_label.220hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 220 hPa.
vertical_label.500hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 500 hPa.
vertical_label.560hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 560 hPa.
vertical_label.700hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 700 hPa.
vertical_label.840hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 840 hPa.
vertical_label.850hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 850 hPa.
vertical_label.925hPa: Data is reported at an atmospheric pressure of 925hPa.
vertical_label.al: Data is reported on the model's atmospheric model levels.
vertical_label.alh: Data is reported on the model's atmospheric model half-levels (i.e. at the interfaces between model vertical layers).
vertical_label.d0m: Data is reported at the surface.
vertical_label.d100cm: Data is reported at a vertical depth of 1m (100cm).
vertical_label.d100m: Data is reported at a vertical depth of 100m.
vertical_label.d10cm: Data is reported at a vertical depth of 0.1m (10cm).
vertical_label.d2000m: Data is reported over the upper 2000m of the ocean.
vertical_label.d300m: Data is reported over the upper 300m of the ocean.
vertical_label.d700m: Data is reported over the upper 700m of the ocean.
vertical_label.h100m: Data is reported at a vertical height of 100m.
vertical_label.h10m: Data is reported at a vertical height of 10m.
vertical_label.h16: Data is reported at 16 height levels.
vertical_label.h2m: Data is reported at a vertical height of 2m.
vertical_label.h40: Data is reported at 40 height levels
vertical_label.ol: Data is reported on the model's ocean model levels.
vertical_label.olh: Data is reported on the model's ocean model half-levels (i.e. at the interfaces between model vertical layers).
vertical_label.op4: Data is reported at 4 ocean pressure layers.
vertical_label.p19: Data is reported at 19 pressure levels.
vertical_label.p27: Data is reported at 27 pressure levels.
vertical_label.p3: Data is reported at 3 pressure levels
vertical_label.p39: Data is reported at 39 pressure levels.
vertical_label.p4: Data is reported at 4 pressure levels.
vertical_label.p5u: Data is reported at 5 pressure levels.
vertical_label.p6: Data is reported at 6 pressure levels.
vertical_label.p7c: Data is reported at 7 pressure levels (although they're not the same pressure levels as `p7h`).
vertical_label.p7h: Data is reported at 7 pressure levels (although they're not the same pressure levels as `p7c`).
vertical_label.p8: Data is reported at 8 pressure levels.
vertical_label.rho: Data is reported on specific density surface(s).
vertical_label.sl: Data is reported on the model's soil model levels.
vertical_label.u: Data is reported with no vertical dimension. This does not necessarily mean that there is no vertical information attached to the variable, it is just not included in the dimension information. Vertical information could alternately be found in the variable's standard name or cell methods.
